How does Java achieve platform independence?
hint: bytecode and Java Virtual Machine
What is ClassLoader in Java?
hint: part of JVM that loads bytecodes for classes. You can write your own.
Difference between ArrayList and HashSet in Java?
hint: all differences between List and Set are applicable here, e.g. ordering, duplicates, random search, etc.
What is double-checked locking in Singleton?
hint: two-time check whether instances are initialized or not, first without locking and second with locking.
How do you create thread-safe Singleton in Java?
hint: many ways, like using Enum or by using double-checked locking pattern or using a nested static class.
Can we override the private method in Java?
hint: No, because itâ€™s not visible in the subclass, a primary requirement for overriding a method in Java.
Difference between Hashtable and HashMap in Java?
hint: several but most important is Hashtable, which is synchronized, while HashMap is not. It's also legacy and slow as compared to HashMap.
Difference between Listand Set in Java?
hint: List is ordered and allows duplicate. Set is unordered and doesn't allow duplicate elements.
Difference between ArrayList and Vector in Java ?
hint: Many, but most important is that ArrayList is non-synchronized and fast while Vector is synchronized and slow. It's also legacy class like Hashtable.
Difference between wait and sleep in Java?
hint: The wait() method releases the lock or monitor, while sleep doesn't.
Why do you override hashcode, along with equals() in Java?
hint: to be compliant with equals and hashcode contract, which is required if you are planning to store your object into collection classes, e.g. HashMap or ArrayList.
Difference between ArrayList and LinkedList in Java?
hint: same as an array and linked list, one allows random search while the other doesn't. Insertion and deletion are easy on the linked list but a search is easy on an array.
How does Autoboxing of Integer work in Java?
hint: By using the valueOf() method in Java.
Difference between PATH and Classpath in Java?
hint: PATH is used by the operating system while Classpath is used by JVM to locate Java binary, e.g. JAR files or Class files.
Difference between method overloading and overriding in Java?
hint: Overriding happens at subclass while overloading happens in the same class. Also, overriding is a runtime activity while overloading is resolved at compile time.
How do you prevent a class from being sub-classed in Java?
hint: just make its constructor private
How do you restrict your class from being used by your client?
hint: make the constructor private or throw an exception from the constructor
Difference between StringBuilder and StringBuffer in Java?
hint: StringBuilder is not synchronized while StringBuffer is synchronized.
Difference between Polymorphism and Inheritance in Java?
hint: Inheritance allows code reuse and builds the relationship between classes, which is required by Polymorphism, which provides dynamic behavior.
Can we override the static method in Java?
hint: No, because overriding resolves at runtime while static method call is resolved at compile time.
Can we access the private method in Java?
hint: yes, in the same class but not outside the class. But we can do with reflection

Difference between the throw and throws keyword in Java?
hint: throws declare what exception a method can throw in case of error but throw keyword actually throws an exception

hint: A Map, which uses the == equality operator to check equality instead of the equals() method.

hint: this refers to the current instance while super refers to an instance of the superclass.

Difference between Error and Exception in Java?
What is Java? Explain its key features.
Java is a high-level programming language known for its platform independence, object-oriented nature, and robustness.
What is the difference between JDK and JVM?
JDK (Java Development Kit) is a software development environment that provides tools for developing and running Java applications. JVM (Java Virtual Machine) is an abstract machine that executes Java bytecode.
What are the basic data types in Java?
The basic data types in Java are int, double, char, boolean, byte, short, long, float.
Explain the difference between a class and an object.
A class is a blueprint or template for creating objects, while an object is an instance of a class.
What is inheritance in Java? How is it implemented?
Inheritance is a mechanism in Java where a class inherits properties and methods from another class. It is implemented using the 'extends' keyword.
What is the difference between abstract classes and interfaces?
An abstract class can have both abstract and non-abstract methods, while an interface can only have abstract methods.
What is method overloading and method overriding?
Method overloading is the ability to define multiple methods with the same name but different parameters. Method overriding is the ability to provide a different implementation of a method in a subclass.
What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword in Java?
The 'static' keyword in Java is used to create variables and methods that belong to the class rather than an instance of the class.
Explain the concept of exception handling in Java.
Exception handling is a mechanism to handle runtime errors and exceptional conditions in Java. It uses try-catch-finally blocks to catch and handle exceptions.
What are the access modifiers in Java?
The access modifiers in Java are public, private, protected, and default (no modifier).
How does garbage collection work in Java?
Garbage collection in Java is the process of automatically reclaiming memory occupied by objects that are no longer in use.
Explain the difference between ArrayList and LinkedList.
ArrayList is implemented as a dynamic array, while LinkedList is implemented as a doubly-linked list.
What is the difference between an abstract class and an interface?
An abstract class can have both abstract and non-abstract methods, while an interface can only have abstract methods.
What is the purpose of the 'final' keyword in Java?
The 'final' keyword in Java is used to declare constants, make a class not inheritable, or make a method not overridden.
What is the difference between checked and unchecked exceptions?
Checked exceptions are checked at compile-time and must be handled or declared, while unchecked exceptions are not checked at compile-time.
Explain the difference between a StringBuffer and a StringBuilder.
StringBuilder is mutable (can be modified), while StringBuffer is also mutable but thread-safe (synchronized).
1. What are the different types of loops in Java?
The different types of loops in Java are for loop, while loop, and do-while loop.
What is a constructor? How is it different from a method?
A constructor is a special method used to initialize objects. It has the same name as the class and doesn't have a return type.
What is the purpose of the 'transient' keyword in Java?
The 'transient' keyword in Java is used to indicate that a variable should not be serialized.

1. Explain the concept of multithreading in Java.
Multithreading in Java is the concurrent execution of two or more threads to achieve better performance and responsiveness.
1. What are synchronization and locking in Java?
Synchronization and locking in Java are mechanisms to ensure that only one thread can access a shared resource at a time, preventing data inconsistency and thread interference.
1. What is the difference between a shallow copy and a deep copy?
A shallow copy creates a new object but references the same memory locations, while a deep copy creates a new object with a new set of memory locations.
What is the purpose of the 'volatile' keyword in Java?
1. The 'volatile' keyword in Java is used to indicate that a variable may be modified by multiple threads and should not be cached.

How does Java handle multiple inheritance?
1. Java doesn't support multiple inheritance for classes but supports multiple inheritance for interfaces.
What is autoboxing and unboxing in Java?
Autoboxing is the automatic conversion of primitive types to their corresponding wrapper classes, while unboxing is the automatic conversion of wrapper classes to their corresponding primitive types.
Explain the difference between the 'equals()' and '==' methods.
The 'equals()' method compares the content of objects for equality, while the '==' operator compares the references of objects.
What is the purpose of the 'super' keyword in Java?
The 'super' keyword in Java is used to refer to the superclass or parent class of a subclass.
What is the role of the 'this' keyword in Java?
1. The 'this' keyword in Java is used to refer to the current instance of a class.
1. Explain the difference between a HashMap and a TreeMap.
1. HashMap is an unordered collection that uses key-value pairs, while TreeMap is a sorted collection that stores elements in ascending order of keys.
What are annotations in Java? Give some examples.
Annotations in Java provide metadata about classes, methods, variables, and other elements in a Java program. Examples include @Override, @Deprecated, and @SuppressWarnings.
What is the difference between a stack and a queue?
A stack is a Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) data structure, while a queue is a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) data structure.
Explain the concept of method chaining in Java.
Method chaining in Java is a programming style that allows calling multiple methods on the same object in a single line.
What is the purpose of the 'assert' keyword in Java?
The 'assert' keyword in Java is used to test assumptions and catch programming errors during development.
How does Java handle exceptions in a try-catch-finally block?
Java handles exceptions in a try-catch-finally block by executing the code in the try block and catching any exceptions in the catch block. The finally block is executed regardless of whether an exception occurs.
What is the purpose of the 'break' and 'continue' statements in Java?
The 'break' statement is used to exit a loop, while the 'continue' statement is used to skip the current iteration and move to the next iteration.
Explain the concept of polymorphism in Java.
Polymorphism in Java is the ability of an object to take on many forms. It allows objects of different classes to be treated as objects of a common superclass.

What is the difference between a private, protected, and public class member?
A private class member can only be accessed within the same class, a protected class member can be accessed within the same package or subclasses, and a public class member can be accessed from anywhere.
How are interfaces different from abstract classes?
Interfaces are fully abstract classes that define a contract for classes to implement, while abstract classes can have both abstract and non-abstract methods.
Explain the concept of anonymous classes in Java.
Anonymous classes in Java are classes without a name that are defined and instantiated in a single expression.
What is the purpose of the 'finally' block in exception handling?
1. The 'finally' block in exception handling is used to define code that is always executed, regardless of whether an exception occurs or not.

1. Method overriding is the ability to provide a different implementation of a method in a subclass, allowing the subclass to have its own version of the method.
1. What is the purpose of the 'implements' keyword in Java?
The 'implements' keyword in Java is used to indicate that a class implements an interface, inheriting its abstract methods.
1. What is the role of the 'throw' keyword in Java?
The 'throw' keyword in Java is used to explicitly throw an exception.
How does Java handle memory management?
1. Java handles memory management through automatic garbage collection, where objects that are no longer referenced are automatically reclaimed.
1. Explain the concept of lambda expressions in Java.
Lambda expressions in Java are anonymous functions that allow the concise representation of functional interfaces. They enable functional programming features in Java.

What is a singleton class?
A singleton class in java can have only one instance and hence all its methods and variables belong to just one instance. Singleton class concept is useful for the situations when there is a need to limit the number of objects for a class.
The best example of singleton usage scenario is when there is a limit of having only one connection to a database due to some driver limitations or because of any licensing issues.

What is the difference between an Inner Class and a Sub-Class?
An Inner class is a class which is nested within another class. An Inner class has access rights for the class which is nesting it and it can access all variables and methods defined in the outer class.
A sub-class is a class which inherits from another class called super class. Sub-class can access all public and protected methods and fields of its super class.

What is data encapsulation and whatâ€™s its significance?
Encapsulation is a concept in Object Oriented Programming for combining properties and methods in a single unit.
Encapsulation helps programmers to follow a modular approach for software development as each object has its own set of methods and variables and serves its functions independent of other objects. Encapsulation also serves data hiding purpose.

What is the difference between double and float variables in Java?
In java, float takes 4 bytes in memory while Double takes 8 bytes in memory. Float is single precision floating point decimal number while Double is double precision decimal number.

Can main() method in Java can return any data?
In java, main() method canâ€™t return any data and hence, itâ€™s always declared with a void return type.
Can we declare a class as Abstract without having any abstract method?
Yes we can create an abstract class by using abstract keyword before class name even if it doesnâ€™t have any abstract method. However, if a class has even one abstract method, it must be declared as abstract otherwise it will give an error.
Whatâ€™s the difference between an Abstract Class and Interface in Java?
The primary difference between an abstract class and interface is that an interface can only possess declaration of public static methods with no concrete implementation while an abstract class can have members with any access specifiers (public, private etc) with or without concrete implementation.
How an object is serialized in java?
In java, to convert an object into byte stream by serialization, an interface with the name Serializable is implemented by the class. All objects of a class implementing serializable interface get serialized and their state is saved in byte stream.
When we should use serialization?
Serialization is used when data needs to be transmitted over the network. Using serialization, objectâ€™s state is saved and converted into byte stream .The byte stream is transferred over the network and the object is re-created at destination.

Can we override static methods of a class?
We cannot override static methods. Static methods belong to a class and not to individual objects and are resolved at the time of compilation (not at runtime).Even if we try to override static method, we will not get an complitaion error,nor the impact of overriding when running the code.
Is String a data type in java?
String is not a primitive data type in java. When a string is created in java, itâ€™s actually an object of Java.Lang.String class that gets created. After creation of this string object, all built-in methods of String class can be used on the string object.
Why Strings in Java are called as Immutable?
In java, string objects are called immutable as once value has been assigned to a string, it canâ€™t be changed and if changed, a new object is created.
Whatâ€™s the difference between an array and Vector?
An array groups data of same primitive type and is static in nature while vectors are dynamic in nature and can hold data of different data types.
What is multi-threading?
Multi threading is a programming concept to run multiple tasks in a concurrent manner within a single program. Threads share same process stack and running in parallel. It helps in performance improvement of any program.

Why Runnable Interface is used in Java?
Runnable interface is used in java for implementing multi threaded applications. Java.Lang.Runnable interface is implemented by a class to support multi threading.
What are the two ways of implementing multi-threading in Java?
Multi threaded applications can be developed in Java by using any of the following two methodologies:
By using Java.Lang.Runnable Interface. Classes implement this interface to enable multi threading. There is a Run() method in this interface which is implemented.
By writing a class that extend Java.Lang.Thread class.
When a lot of changes are required in data, which one should be a preference to be used? String or StringBuffer?
Since StringBuffers are dynamic in nature and we can change the values of StringBuffer objects unlike String which is immutable, itâ€™s always a good choice to use StringBuffer when data is being changed too much. If we use String in such a case, for every data change a new String object will be created which will be an extra overhead.
How garbage collection is done in Java?
In java, when an object is not referenced any more, garbage collection takes place and the object is destroyed automatically. For automatic garbage collection java calls either System.gc() method or Runtime.gc() method.
How we can execute any code even before main method?
If we want to execute any statements before even creation of objects at load time of class, we can use a static block of code in the class. Any statements inside this static block of code will get executed once at the time of loading the class even before creation of objects in the main method.

How can we make copy of a java object?
We can use the concept of cloning to create copy of an object. Using clone, we create copies with the actual state of an object.
Clone() is a method of Cloneable interface and hence, Cloneable interface needs to be implemented for making object copies.
Whatâ€™s the benefit of using inheritance?
Key benefit of using inheritance is reusability of code as inheritance enables sub-classes to reuse the code of its super class. Polymorphism (Extensibility) is another great benefit which allow new functionality to be introduced without effecting existing derived classes.

Whatâ€™s the default access specifier for variables and methods of a class?
Default access specifier for variables and method is package protected i.e variables and class is available to any other class but in the same package, not outside the package.
How can we restrict inheritance for a class so that no class can be inherited from it?
If we want a class not to be extended further by any class, we can use the keyword Final with the class name.
107. Whatâ€™s difference between Stack and Queue?
Stack and Queue both are used as placeholder for a collection of data. The primary difference between a stack and a queue is that stack is based on Last in First out (LIFO) principle while a queue is based on FIFO (First In First Out) principle.

Describe different states of a thread.
A thread in Java can be in either of the following states:
Ready: When a thread is created, itâ€™s in Ready state.
Running: A thread currently being executed is in running state.
Waiting: A thread waiting for another thread to free certain resources is in waiting state.
Dead: A thread which has gone dead after execution is in dead state.
Can we use a default constructor of a class even if an explicit constructor is defined?
Java provides a default no argument constructor if no explicit constructor is defined in a Java class. But if an explicit constructor has been defined, default constructor canâ€™t be invoked and developer can use only those constructors which are defined in the class.
Can we override a method by using same method name and arguments but different return types?
The basic condition of method overriding is that method name, arguments as well as return type must be exactly same as is that of the method being overridden. Hence using a different return type doesnâ€™t override a method.
Can a dead thread be started again?
: In java, a thread which is in dead state canâ€™t be started again. There is no way to restart a dead thread.
Is JDK required on each machine to run a Java program?
JDK is development Kit of Java and is required for development only and to run a Java program on a machine, JDK isnâ€™t required. Only JRE is required.
Can a variable be local and static at the same time?
No a variable canâ€™t be static as well as local at the same time. Defining a local variable as static gives compilation error.
Can we have static methods in an Interface?
Ans: Static methods canâ€™t be overridden in any class while any methods in an interface are by default abstract and are supposed to be implemented in the classes being implementing the interface. So it makes no sense to have static methods in an interface in Java.
Can we have any other return type than void for main method?
Ans: No, Java class main method can have only void return type for the program to get successfully executed. Nonetheless , if you absolutely must return a value to at the completion of main method , you can use System.exit(int status)
I want to re-reach and use an object once it has been garbage collected. How itâ€™s possible?
Ans: Once an object has been destroyed by garbage collector, it no longer exists on the heap and it canâ€™t be accessed again. There is no way to reference it again.
In Java thread programming, which method is a must implementation for all threads?
Ans: Run() is a method of Runnable interface that must be implemented by all threads.
I want to control database connections in my program and want that only one thread should be able to make database connection at a time. How can I implement this logic?
Ans: This can be implemented by use of the concept of synchronization. Database related code can be placed in a method which hs synchronized keyword so that only one thread can access it at a time.
I want my class to be developed in such a way that no other class (even derived class) can create its objects. How can I do so?
Ans: If we declare the constructor of a class as private, it will not be accessible by any other class and hence, no other class will be able to instantiate it and formation of its object will be limited to itself only.
How objects are stored in Java?
Ans: In java, each object when created gets a memory space from a heap. When an object is destroyed by a garbage collector, the space allocated to it from the heap is re-allocated to the heap and becomes available for any new objects.
How can we find the actual size of an object on the heap?
Ans: In java, there is no way to find out the exact size of an object on the heap.
Which of the following classes will have more memory allocated?
Class A: Three methods, four variables, no object
Class B: Five methods, three variables, no object
Ans: Memory isnâ€™t allocated before creation of objects. Since for both classes, there are no objects created so no memory is allocated on heap for any class.
I have multiple constructors defined in a class. Is it possible to call a constructor from another constructorâ€™s body?
Ans: If a class has multiple constructors, itâ€™s possible to call one constructor from the body of another one using this().
What is a Local class in Java?
Ans: In Java, if we define a new class inside a particular block, itâ€™s called a local class. Such a class has local scope and isnâ€™t usable outside the block where its defined.
String and StringBuffer both represent String objects. Can we compare String and StringBuffer in Java?
Ans: Although String and StringBuffer both represent String objects, we canâ€™t compare them with each other and if we try to compare them, we get an error.
Can we cast any other type to Boolean Type with type casting?
Ans: No, we can neither cast any other primitive type to Boolean data type nor can cast Boolean data type to any other primitive data type.
Can we use different return types for methods when overridden?
Ans: The basic requirement of method overriding in Java is that the overridden method should have same name, and parameters.But a method can be overridden with a different return type as long as the new return type extends the original.
Whatâ€™s the base class of all exception classes?
Ans: In Java, Java.lang.Throwable is the super class of all exception classes and all exception classes are derived from this base class.
Whatâ€™s the order of call of constructors in inheritance?
Ans: In case of inheritance, when a new object of a derived class is created, first the constructor of the super class is invoked and then the constructor of the derived class is invoked.

Joinler. Onlara aid numuneye baxmaq.
Joinler iki 2 table arasindaki uygun olan deyerleri getirerek bir table ekranda gostermem ucun istifade olunur, 4 cur Join var
Inner join - Iki table in yalniz uygun olan setrlerini getirir
left join - sol terefdeki tablein butun fieldlerini , sag terefdekilerin ise yalniz uygun olan
right join - sag terefdeki table in butun fieldlerini, sol terefdekinin ise yalniz uygun olan
full join - her iki table in hem uygun hem uygun olmayan fieldlerini getirir. uygun olduqda qarsi qarsiya , uygun olmadiqda ise qarsisinda null olaraq qeyd olunur.
meselen
select pizza.id, pizza.pizza_name, customer.name, customer.id from customer full join pizza ON pizza.id=customer.id
burada Left table Customerdi, right ise pizza

Java EE

ORM nedir ? Object Relation Mapping . ORM le JPA arasindaki ferq nedir ?
ORM butun obyekt yonumlu proqramlasdirma dilleri ucun hazirlanmis spesifikasiyadir, jpa ise ORM in sirf Java ucun hazirlanmis spesifikasiyasidir.
ORM deyir ki ele bir SQL imkani yaratamaq lazimdi ki bu sql ile bazadan melumati dartib birbasa obyekte set oluna bilsin. Bu ORM de qaydadi bu butun OOP dilleri tetbiq etmelidir.
JPA da deyir ki: Sizin query nizin adi JPQL dir. Onun istifade qaydasi. Basqa bir numune: ORM de deyir ki butun classlarin Tablelarla ifadesi olmalidi . JPA da ise deyir ki Table ifade eden classin basinda @Table anotasiyasi olmalidi.
What is JPA ? JPA ile Hibernate arasindaki ferq nedir ?
JPA is a specification that provides an object-relational mapping (ORM) framework for Java EE applications. It allows developers to map Java objects to relational database tables and perform database operations using an object-oriented approach.
JPA bir spesifikasiyadir , Hibernate onu implement edib.
JPA bir spesifikasiyadir hansi ki orda qeyd olunub interfeysler, anotasiyalar ve s. . Ve biz bu anotasiyalari yazanda bu anotasiyalar islemlidir. Bu anotasilar havadan isleye bilmez. Hansisa kod onu gormelidi emal etmelidi run elemlidi. Bunu da islede bilmek ucun bunu implementasiya eden classlar olamlidi. Bunu da implement eden classlar olmalidi
When answering the interview question about the difference between JPA and Hibernate, you can structure your response as follows:
Start with a concise definition of each term:
JPA: Java Persistence API is a Java specification that defines a standard set of interfaces and annotations for object-relational mapping (ORM) in Java applications.
Hibernate: Hibernate is an implementation of the JPA specification and one of the most popular ORM frameworks in the Java ecosystem.
Explain the relationship between JPA and Hibernate:
Mention that Hibernate is a specific implementation of the JPA specification.
Emphasize that Hibernate provides a robust and feature-rich ORM framework, building upon the foundation established by JPA.
Highlight the key differences:
JPA is a specification, while Hibernate is an implementation of that specification.
JPA provides a common and standardized way to work with persistence in Java applications, promoting interoperability between different ORM frameworks.
Hibernate offers additional functionalities and features beyond the JPA standard, such as Hibernate Query Language (HQL), caching mechanisms, transaction management, and more.
Summarize the relationship:
Clarify that Hibernate implements the JPA specification, providing a powerful ORM framework with enhanced capabilities.
Mention that other ORM frameworks can also implement the JPA specification, but Hibernate is one of the most widely-used and feature-rich implementations.
Hibernate ve EclipseLink arasindaki ferq nedir ?
EclipsLink JPA spesifikasiyasini tam implementasiya edir. Ve bu implementasiyadan qiraga cixmir, Meselen: JPA da Entity Table anotasiyasi varsa bu anotasiyalari implementasiya edib cekilir qiraga.
Hibernate: Amma Hibernate JPA ni tam implementasiya edir bundan savayi oz anoatasiyalarini oz funksiyalarini da getirir.
Novbeti ferqi:
Hibernatein diger ustunlukleri de var. Performansda Hibernate Eclipselinkden qabagadi,
Sonra cacheing sistemi var ki Hibernate in caching sistemi meshurdu bunu cox istifade edirler.EclipseLink de ise bu xussiyyetler yoxdur.
Xulase Hibernate EclipseLinkden qabagadi performasnda, 2 ci Hibernate in JPA spesifikasiyasindan qlraqdan getirdiyi funksiylar var, hansi ki EclipseLink calisir ki, JPA ni maximum implementasiya etsin.

COMMIT ise odu ki, senin butun emeliyyatlarin ugurlu oldu. Commit eliyirsen Tesdiqliyirsen ki, beli tesdiqliyirem bunu icra edin .

What is Inversion of Control ?
Container Obyektleri yaradir, onlari oldurur. Qisaca onlarin LifeCycle ozu idare edir. Ve bu obyektleri Contextde yerlesdirir. Ve lazim olduqda oradan goturub istifade edir. Madam ki bu obyekti ozu yaradir ve ozu idare edir, buna deyirler ki, Inversion of Control. Inversion of Control deyende herfi menada Kontrolun yer deyismesi demekdir yeni Obyektin yaranma kontrolunun, yaranmasinin, idare olunmasinin yer deyismesi demekdir. Bunu proqramist evezine container edir. Belelikle proqramistle container arasinda yer deyisir.

What is Query and NativeQuery ?
@RequestParam nedir? @PathVariable nedir ?
In Spring, the @RequestParam annotation is used to bind a request parameter value to a method parameter in a Spring MVC controller. It is used to extract data from the request URL's query parameters or form data.
When you define a method parameter with the @RequestParam annotation, Spring will automatically bind the value of the specified request parameter to that parameter.
RequestParam. URLde ? sual isaresinden sonra yazilan parametlerdir
PathVariable URLde / -den sonra id vermisikse hemin id ni tutmaq ucun istifade olunur
What is Spring ?
Spring Boot is a framework that simplifies the development of Java applications by providing defaults and conventions for configuration. It aims to make it easy to create standalone, production-grade Spring-based applications.
SpringBoot nedir ? Ve onun ustunlukleri nedir ?
Some advantages of using Spring Boot include simplified configuration, auto-configuration of dependencies, embedded servers, production-ready features, and increased developer productivity.
SPRING BOOT ozunde bezi classlar getrir ki bu claslari avtomatik konfiqrasya etmek imkan veri. meselen webi, bazani, ve s, avtomaitk konfiqrasiya etmek imkani verir. Boot ollmasa da ede bilersen lakin ozun tek tek classlar yaratmalisan ki bunu konfiqqrasiya etsin. Boot olduqda ise bu konfiqrasiyalar avtomatik olur.
Mesleen adice application.properties spring.datasource yazib bazanin filan adini yazib rahat qosula bilirikse bu springbootun bize verdiyi imkandir.
Springboot neyniyir ? webe qosulmaq ucun , database ucun , restfull api yazma qucun ve konfiqrasiyalari avtomatik bizim ucun edir, Numune olaraq application properties burda bezi konfiqrasiyalar yazmaq biz bazaya qosula bilerik
What is difference between Spring and SpringBoot ?
In summary, while Spring offers extensive flexibility and configurability, Spring Boot streamlines the development process by providing out-of-the-box conventions and defaults, allowing developers to create Spring-based applications with minimal effort and configuration. Spring Boot is often considered a more opinionated and streamlined version of Spring, geared towards rapid application development and deployment.
Spring boot olmasaydi qarsilasdigimiz cetinlikler:
MVC qosmaq cetinliklik olardi. MVC ni qosmaq ucun konfiqurasiya classlari yaratmaliyiq
JPA qosulmaq cetinlik olardi. Springde JPA qosulmaq ucun konfiqurasiya classlari yaratmaliyiq.
SpringBoot bu classlari yaratmaqdan bizi azad edir. Nece ? .properties faylina girib baza melumatlarin yazmaqla bazaya asanliqla qosulmus olariq.
MVC e geldikde onu qosmaq ucun elave konfiqrasiyalara ehtiyyac qalmir avtomatik MVC ni layiheye qosmus olur.

What is ApplicationContext ?
The ApplicationContext is the central interface in Spring for providing configuration and managing the lifecycle of beans in a Spring application. It represents the Spring IoC (Inversion of Control) container and provides the runtime environment for the application.
In simpler terms, the ApplicationContext is responsible for creating, initializing, and wiring beans together based on the application's configuration. It acts as a container for holding the application's beans and manages their dependencies and lifecycle.
The ApplicationContext provides several key functionalities:
Dependency Injection: The ApplicationContext uses dependency injection to resolve and inject dependencies between beans. It manages the relationships between beans, allowing for loose coupling and easier testing and maintenance.
Bean Lifecycle Management: The ApplicationContext handles the lifecycle of beans, including their creation, initialization, and destruction. It invokes the appropriate lifecycle methods (such as initializingBean's afterPropertiesSet() or @PostConstruct annotated methods) to ensure proper initialization and cleanup of beans.
Configuration Management: The ApplicationContext loads and manages the application's configuration. It can read configuration from various sources such as XML files, Java annotations, Java-based configuration classes, or property files. It interprets the configuration and uses it to create and configure beans.
Application Event Publishing: The ApplicationContext supports the publishing and handling of application events. It allows beans to publish events, and other beans can listen and respond to those events. This enables communication and coordination between different parts of the application.
The ApplicationContext interface extends the BeanFactory interface, which is the core Spring IoC container. The ApplicationContext provides additional features and functionality on top of the basic BeanFactory, making it the preferred choice in most Spring applications.
Spring provides different implementations of the ApplicationContext interface, such as AnnotationConfigApplicationContext, ClassPathXmlApplicationContext, and others. Each implementation supports a specific configuration style (XML-based, annotation-based, etc.) and allows you to choose the most suitable one for your application.
Overall, the ApplicationContext plays a crucial role in managing the configuration, dependencies, and lifecycle of beans in a Spring application, providing the necessary infrastructure for building robust and modular applications.

AOP nedir ? Aspect and Logging ?
Ferz edek ki bizim bir methodumuz onu istiyirik ki bir mexanizme qosaq onun ne qeder cagrildigini gorek. Qiraqda bir dene class duzeldirik. Onun uzerinde bezi anotasiyalar olur. Bu anotasilayalar qeyd edirsen ki filan package icersindeki fiilan classdaki filan method cagrildiginda filan is gorulsun. bu filan isin icersinde istediyimiz her seyi gore bilerik meselen o mexanizmi qosa bilerik, email gondere bilerik,exceptionlari tuta bilerik, loglaya bilerik. Neye gore Aspect Oriented Programming deyilir. fikir verdinizse class qiraqda yaranir ve qiraqda dayanan class diger obyektlere qulaq asa bilir. qulaq asa bilir ki filan obyektin filan methodu cagrilanda filan seyi edir. qiraqdan durub qulaq asir
Kenardan proqramlasmiraya yanasma. Kenardan proyektin icine proyektin classlarina muraciet etmeden her hansisa kodlama edirsen. AOP vasitesile exceptioinlarda yazib try catch den azad ola bilerik.
SOAP nedir, nece isleyir ?
SOAP XMLâ€™lerle isleyir ve WSDL file olur, ve WSDL filein icerisende meselen sen bir dene servis yazmisan ve url.com/1?wsdl urlden sonra sual iserasi qoyub wsdl yazdiqdan sonra sene bir dene xml gelir. Bu xml nedir ? Bu xml senin soap servisin qebul etdiyi ve ya return elediyi obyektlerin parametrlerin siyahisidir. Sen bu WSDL den istifsade ederek tutaq ki Javada hemin soapi cagirmaq isteyirsen. Bu wsdl istifade ederek class duzeldirsen bu classlar da tutraq ki studentRepository ni save methodunu cagiracaqsan hemin o class icine parametrleri doldurub bu methodu cagiranda bu neyniyir. bu obratni goturur student classindan xml duzeldir student repositoryni de oz xml ni duzeldir deyir ki men qarsi terefdeki servisin student repositorysin save methodu cagiriram icersine student otururem . amma bunlari xml formasinda deyir. sen classi doldurursan amma sen proyekti run edende xml fayl yaranir ve hhtp ile qarsi terefe sorgu gedir, xml gedir. xml icinde deyirsen ki men student repo un save methodunu cagiriram ora student obyektini gonderirem student obyektin icinde de bu parametrler var ve deyerleri de budu . Konkret xml gonderirsen. Qarsi teref de xml abratni classsa cevirir o student alir, student repoun save in cagirir insert gedir sene xml le cavab verir.
yeni qisasi iki proyekt arasuinda xmller gedib gelir amm aher iki proyektin developerleri classlari gorur niye xmller classa cevrilir classlarlar abratni xmle cevrilir.
Soap data secure oldugu deyilir.

What is the purpose of the @RestController annotation in Spring Boot?
The @RestController annotation in Spring Boot combines the functionality of th upe @Controller and @ResponseBody annotations. It is used to define RESTful web service controllers, where methods annotated with @RequestMapping return the response directly as JSON/XML instead of relying on a view resolver.
How do you handle exceptions in a Spring Boot application?
Exceptions in a Spring Boot application can be handled using the @ExceptionHandler annotation to define methods that handle specific exceptions. You can also use the @ControllerAdvice annotation to define global exception handlers.
How do you implement caching in a Spring Boot application?
Caching in a Spring Boot application can be implemented using annotations such as @Cacheable, @CacheEvict, and @CachePut from the Spring Framework. These annotations allow you to cache the results of expensive or frequently accessed operations.
What is the purpose of the @SpringBootApplication annotation?
The @SpringBootApplication annotation is a combination of three annotations: @Configuration, @EnableAutoConfiguration, and @ComponentScan. It marks the main class of a Spring Boot application and enables auto-configuration and component scanning.
How does Spring Boot simplify configuration compared to traditional Spring applications?
Spring Boot uses sensible defaults and automatic configuration based on classpath dependencies, reducing the need for manual configuration. It also provides externalized configuration options through properties or YAML files.
What is auto-configuration in Spring Boot?
Auto-configuration in Spring Boot automatically configures beans and other components based on the classpath dependencies present in the application. It eliminates the need for manual configuration by analyzing the environment and providing sensible defaults.
Kohne bir kitabxana var ve bu kitabxananin terkibinde a deye bir class var. bu class Spring kitabxanasi deyil deye bu classin basinda ne Component var ne @Service var. Men bu classin obyektini nece ede bilerem ki Spring onun obyektini yaratsin ve men onun obyektini @Autowired ede bilim ?
Bir class yaradib adini BeanConfiguration yaziriq.
Biz bura @Configuration yazmisiq deye bu class avtomatik Spring terefinden ise salinir ve bunun icersinde yaratmis oldugum yaradib returm etdiyim obyektler Spring Containere doldurulur yazmis oldugumuz konteynerin adiyla artiq bundan sonra bunu istediyimiz yerde override ede bilerik.
Biz @Bean anotasiyasi yazmaqla deyir ki, bu classsin obyektin artiq Contexte elave edirik
Bundan basqa bir yol ise eger biz bir class obyektin yaradib Autowired etmek isteyirkkse bu classin ustune @Component anotasiyasi yazmaliq.
JPA â€˜in JDBCâ€™den ustunlukleri nedir ?
JPA istifade etsek de o arxada JDBC isledir. Isin koku gedir cixir JDBC e. Meselen bazaya qosulacaqsansa, bzaya nese execute edeceksense sql gondereceksense illa ki gedib JDBC e cixacaqsan. Sadece JPA JDBC in uzerinde qurulmus bir layerdi. Onun uzerinde qurulmus bir spesifikasiyadir, ust leveldi.

JAX-RS nedir ? Jersey nedir ?

DTO nedir ?
Acilisi Data Transfer Objectdir. Biz bunu istifade edirik, proyektin daxilinde bir metoddan diger metoda. bir obyektden diger obyekte her hansisa bir data otureceyikse entity oturmek evezine dto lari otururuk. Niye bele edirik ona gore bele edirik entityleri birbasa ekrana versek entity icindeki adlar ki var onlari oldugu ad ile birbasa ekrana vermeli olaciyiq. hemcinin de entitynin icersinde tutaq ki 50 dene parametr varsa men belke 50 dene parametr in hamsini ekrana vermek istemirem ona gore de sirf ekrana aid olan fronta aid olan bir dto duzeldirem. Bunun icersine de sirf fronta aid olan fieldleri yaziram, belelikle ekrana sirf hemin fieldler qayidir.
Proyektin daxilinde ise dto nu o zaman istifade edirem ki mesleen menim 1 entitym var amma menim ele bir methodum var ki ve bu method sadece hemin entitynin bir dene parametrini istemirem. Men de butun entitynin topluyub gondere bilmerem axi bunun evezine bir dto duzeldirem ve entityden istifade dederek hemin dtonu doldururam ve hemin methodun istediyi fieldleri yaziram ve bu methodu hansisa methoda gonderirem ki senin istediyin obyekt budur gotur istifade ele . Burda ektana bir sey vermedim. sadece method bizden bezi fieldleri isteyir ve men bezi fieldlerden ibaret bir dene dto duzeltdim.
Springâ€™de obyektlerin islemesi necedir ?
Spring de butun obyektler proxy ile yaradilir.Eger sen her hansisa bir obyekti Autowired eliyirikse eger men burda bu obyektin classin adini capa versem hec o obyektin classin adini gormeyecem. Onun yerine . Cunku springde butun obyektler proxy ile yaradilir. Lyuboy obyekt bir dene obyekt yaradilir o proxydi. Bu obyektin icersine bizim esl obyektimiz oturur.esl obyektimiz o proxyâ€™in icersine oturur belelikle sen her hansisa bir methodu cagirdiqda bu eslinde gedir proxy obyektini cagirir onun findall ini cagirir hemin metodun findAll i da iceride esl obyektiun find all ini cagirir.
